engine.rendering

Class ArrayBitmap

  • java.lang.Object
    • engine.rendering.ArrayBitmap

  • public class ArrayBitmap
extends java.lang.Object
    Stores images in an array of 32-bit ARGB pixels.
    Author:
    Benny Bobaganoosh (thebennybox@gmail.com)

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static interface  ArrayBitmap.IVisitor
      Interface for visiting every pixel in an ArrayBitmap.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      ArrayBitmap(int width, int height)
      Creates a new ArrayBitmap
      ArrayBitmap(int width, int height, int[] pixels)
      Creates a new ArrayBitmap from an existing array of 32-bit ARGB pixels.
      ArrayBitmap(int width, int height, int[] pixels, int offsetX, int offsetY, int rowOffset)
      Creates a new ArrayBitmap from a subset of an existing array of 32-bit ARGB pixels.
      ArrayBitmap(java.lang.String fileName)
      Create an ArrayBitmap from a file

    • Constructor Detail

      • ArrayBitmap

        public ArrayBitmap(int width,
           int height)
        Creates a new ArrayBitmap
        Parameters:
        width - The width, in pixels, of the bitmap.
        height - The height, in pixels, of the bitmap.

      • ArrayBitmap

        public ArrayBitmap(int width,
           int height,
           int[] pixels)
        Creates a new ArrayBitmap from an existing array of 32-bit ARGB pixels.
        Parameters:
        width - The width, in pixels, of the bitmap.
        height - The height, in pixels, of the bitmap.
        pixels - The array of 32-bit ARGB pixels to be used.

      • ArrayBitmap

        public ArrayBitmap(int width,
           int height,
           int[] pixels,
           int offsetX,
           int offsetY,
           int rowOffset)
        Creates a new ArrayBitmap from a subset of an existing array of 32-bit ARGB pixels.
        Parameters:
        width - The width, in pixels, of the bitmap.
        height - The height, in pixels, of the bitmap.
        pixels - The array of 32-bit ARGB pixels to be used.
        offsetX - The start of the image in the pixels on X.
        offsetY - The start of the image in the pixels on Y.
        rowOffset - The length of one row of pixels in the pixels array.

      • ArrayBitmap

        public ArrayBitmap(java.lang.String fileName)
            throws java.io.IOException
        Create an ArrayBitmap from a file
        Parameters:
        fileName - The path and name of a file containing an image.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If the file cannot be loaded.

    • Method Detail

      • save

        public void save(java.lang.String fileName,
        java.lang.String outputFormat)
          throws java.io.IOException
        Saves an ArrayBitmap to a file.
        Parameters:
        fileName - The path and name of the file to save to.
        outputFormat - The image format to be used. For example, "png" and "jpg" are valid values.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If the image cannot be saved.

      • visitAll

        public void visitAll(ArrayBitmap.IVisitor visitor)
        Visits every pixel in the image.
        Parameters:
        visitor - To be called at each pixel visited.

      • clear

        public void clear(int color)
        Sets every pixel in the image to the same 32-bit ARGB color.
        Parameters:
        color - The 32-bit ARGB color to set every pixel in the image to.

      • isMoreOpaqueThanTransparent

        public boolean isMoreOpaqueThanTransparent(int x,
                                  int y)
        Returns true if the the pixel's alpha is more than 0.5.
        Parameters:
        x - The X location of the pixel.
        y - The Y location of the pixel.
        Returns:
        True if the pixel's alpha is more than 0.5.

      • get

        public int get(int x,
      int y)
        Get a pixel at a specific location.
        Parameters:
        x - The X location of the pixel.
        y - The Y location of the pixel.
        Returns:
        The pixel at location (x, y).

       int y,

        Sets a pixel at a specific location.
        Parameters:
